column2: A graph is a set of vertices and a collection of edges that each connect a pair of vertices

column1: When vertices are adjacent to one another ?
column2: When there is an edge connecting two vertices, we say that the vertices are adjacent to one another

column1: When edge is incident to both vertices ?
column2: When there is an edge connecting two vertices, we say that the vertices are adjacent to one another and that the edge is incident to both vertices
The degree of a vertex is the number of edges incident to it.
A subgraph is a subset of a graphâ€™s edges (and associated vertices) that constitutes a graph.

column1: Define a path within a graph
column2: A path in a graph is a sequence of vertices connected by edges.

column1: Define a simple path within a graph
column2: A simple path is one with no repeated vertices.

column1: Define a cycle within a graph
column2: A cycle is a path with at least one edge whose first and last vertices are the same.

column1: Define a simple cycle within a graph
column2: A simple cycle is a cycle with no repeated edges or vertices (except the requisite repeti- tion of the first and last vertices)

column1: Define a lengh of path within a graph
column2: The length of a path or a cycle is its number of edges.

column1: When one vertex is connected to another ?
column2: We say that one vertex is connected to another if there exists a path that contains both of them.

column1: When graph considered to be connected ?
column2: A graph is connected if there is a path from every vertex toe very other vertex in the graph
An acyclic graph is a graph without a cycles
A tree is an acyclic connected graph
A disjoint set of trees called a forest
A spanning tree of a connected graph is a subgraph that contains all of that graph vertices and is a single tree

column1: Define a spannign forest of a graph
column2: A spanning forest of a graph is the union of spanning trees of its connected components
A bipartite graph is a graph whose vertices we can divide into two sets such that all edges connect a vertex in one set with a vertex in the other set.
